com.amitinside.featureflags.feature

Interface Feature

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Configurable, Strategizable

    @ConsumerType
public interface Feature
extends Strategizable
    A feature is defined by its name. Features are registered as OSGi services.

    Feature names Strategizable.getName() should be globally unique (case-insensitive). If multiple features have the same name, the feature with the highest service ranking is accessible through the FeatureManager service while those with lower service rankings are ignored. If service rankings are equal, sort by service ID in descending order. That is, services with lower service IDs will be accessible whereas those with higher service IDs are ignored.

    If a feature belongs to a valid feature group or it specifies any valid activation strategy, this would not return the actual enablement value.

    To check enablement of any feature, use FeatureManager.isFeatureEnabled(String).

    This interface is intended to be implemented by feature providers.
    See Also:
    FeatureGroup, FeatureManager, ActivationStrategy

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Stream<String> getGroups()
      The associated group identifiers that will be used to check whether this feature belongs to any group.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.amitinside.featureflags.Strategizable

        getDescription, getName, getStrategy, isEnabled

    • Method Detail

      • getGroups

        Stream<String> getGroups()
        The associated group identifiers that will be used to check whether this feature belongs to any group. A feature can associate multiple groups but the enabled one will only be taken into account.

        If a feature associates multiple groups in which multiple groups are active, then the feature groups are sorted according to their natural order of the names of the groups. Any of the groups with lower sort order and is enabled, would eventually determine the enablement of this feature.

        Returns:
        The group identifiers of this feature or empty Stream
